input: The lion is blue. The lion needs the mouse. The lion sees the squirrel. The mouse eats the tiger. The mouse is rough. The mouse needs the lion. The mouse needs the squirrel. The mouse does not see the tiger. The squirrel needs the mouse. The squirrel needs the tiger. The tiger does not eat the mouse. The tiger is nice. If the squirrel needs the tiger and the tiger eats the lion then the lion is nice. If something is cold then it eats the mouse. If something sees the squirrel and it sees the tiger then the tiger sees the squirrel. If something is cold then it is rough. If something eats the lion then it is rough. If something is nice then it eats the lion. If the lion needs the squirrel and the lion eats the tiger then the lion is green. If the lion is rough then the lion does not eat the mouse. If something eats the lion then the lion eats the tiger. Question: The lion does not eat the mouse.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Lion : obj
constant Mouse : obj
constant Squirrel : obj
constant Tiger : obj

constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Needs : obj → obj → Prop
constant Sees : obj → obj → Prop
constant Eats : obj → obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Blue Lion
axiom T2 : Needs Lion Mouse
axiom T3 : Sees Lion Squirrel
axiom T4 : Eats Mouse Tiger
axiom T5 : Rough Mouse
axiom T6 : Needs Mouse Lion
axiom T7 : Needs Mouse Squirrel
axiom T8 : ¬ Sees Mouse Tiger
axiom T9 : Needs Squirrel Mouse
axiom T10 : Needs Squirrel Tiger
axiom T11 : ¬ Eats Tiger Mouse
axiom T12 : Nice Tiger

axiom R1 : Needs Squirrel Tiger ∧ Eats Tiger Lion → Nice Lion
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x → Eats x Mouse
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Sees x Squirrel ∧ Sees x Tiger → Sees Tiger Squirrel
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x → Rough x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Eats x Lion → Rough x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Eats x Lion
axiom R7 : Needs Lion Squirrel ∧ Eats Lion Tiger → Green Lion
axiom R8 : Rough Lion → ¬ Eats Lion Mouse
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Eats x Lion → Eats Lion Tiger

theorem lion_does_not_eat_mouse : ¬ Eats Lion Mouse :=
begin
  apply R8,
  apply R5,
  apply R6,
  exact T12,
end

-- The answer is True
